title: Complete skeletons of mother and child found in Tower of London
text:
As the infamous royal fortress and prison, the Tower of London is synonymous with the bloodiest of executions and torture, with Henry VIII’s wives Ann Boleyn and Catherine Howard among so many who met a grisly end there.

Now an archaeological dig at the 1,000-year-old site has made a remarkable discovery - two normal burials whose skeletons bear no axe and sword marks of executions or any signs of violent death. They appear to have been ordinary people who had lived at the Tower during the late medieval and early Tudor era.

The skeletons - the first from the historic site to be assessed scientifically - have been identified as a woman aged between 35 and 45 and a child of about seven.

Apparently...
